summary: This is an internal FBI email chain discussing logistical planning for a search warrant execution at Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas. The email coordinates travel dates and agent availability for the operation, which is expected to take 1-3 days.

persons.name: SSA MI Squad C-20
persons.context: Author of the initial email coordinating the search warrant operation for Epstein's island, requesting availability from team members.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The owner of the island off St. Thomas that is the target of the planned FBI search warrant.

connections.description: SSA MI Squad C-20 is coordinating the FBI search of Epstein's private island as part of an investigation.

events.title: Planned Search Warrant Swearing
events.description: The SDNY plans to have the search warrant for Epstein's island sworn out in St. Thomas.

events.title: Planned FBI Travel to St. Thomas
events.description: The FBI team plans to fly out to St. Thomas on an FBI Q400 plane to execute the search warrant.

events.title: Planned Search of Epstein's Island
events.description: The FBI Evidence Response Team (ERT) is expected to conduct a search of Epstein's private island, anticipated to take 1-3 days.

events.title: Planned FBI Travel Home
events.description: The tentative date for the FBI team to return from St. Thomas after the search operation.

keyFacts: The SDNY was drafting a search warrant affidavit for Jeffrey Epstein's private island near St. Thomas in August 2019.
The FBI planned to execute the search warrant using an Evidence Response Team (ERT), with the operation expected to last 1-3 days.
Logistical planning involved FBI agents flying on an FBI Q400 plane, with travel scheduled for August 11 and a return on August 15.
The email indicates active, coordinated law enforcement investigation into Epstein's activities and properties following his arrest.
